item.description:
I got the below invitation today and it sounds like a good time. I am assured all the food will be vegan. If we get a large group I should probably give the organizer a heads up so please respond if you are interested. I realize this is a long ways from New Haven but Windsor Locks is a stop on the Amtrak line(only .04 miles to the event) and there is probably an opportunity to carpool. Email me if you would like to find a ride. Here are the direction from the Amtrak station to the event: http://maps.google.co...

Ben

On February 22 at 5 PM, Northern Connecticut Vegetarians want
to invite the the New Haven Meetup Group to the Celtic/Irish
Vegan Potluck and Entertainment by a lively Celtic Band. The
band features Lisa Furman and BlueFlys Band. Lisa Furman on
guitar, Irish whistle and lead vocals, Chris Teskey on guitar,
Dick Neal on banjo and mandolin and Tahlia Furman on fiddle.
They play a fresh, progressive, eclectic blend of Celtic and
Americana music and perform regularly in southern Connecticut
and the New York City area. Please bring a Healthy Vegan dish
(Celtic if possible) to share along with a list of its
ingredients and attendeeâ€™s name. Also, attendees should bring
their place setting. A donation of $10 per adult is requested;
children are free. The Carniglia Senior Center, 41 Oak Street,
Windsor Locks is the location for this event. For
reservations or questions, call Harry at (860) 623-8082 or
email Harry at veggyharry@aol.com. For more information, see
www.northctveg.org.

Ben, we do hope your group will join us. Rest assured all food
will be VEGAN. The ingredients list for each dish and
nonvegan dishes are removed from the serving table. In fact,
we have 2 food tables at our events--one labeled for RAW VEGAN
and another for VEGAN. Reservations are requested as NCVS
yearly music program is a popular event. The music group comes
from New Haven area.

group.name: The New Haven Vegan Meetup Group

item.name: NCVS Celtic/Irish Vegan Potluck and Entertainment
